In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **P** serves the following purposes:

- p represents a [piercer](/wiki/Piercer "Piercer"):

  - p [rock piercer](/wiki/Rock_piercer "Rock piercer")
  - p [iron piercer](/wiki/Iron_piercer "Iron piercer")
  - p [glass piercer](/wiki/Glass_piercer "Glass piercer")

* P represents a [pudding or ooze](/wiki/Pudding_or_ooze "Pudding or ooze"):

  - P [gray ooze](/wiki/Gray_ooze "Gray ooze")
  - P [brown pudding](/wiki/Brown_pudding "Brown pudding")
  - P [black pudding](/wiki/Black_pudding "Black pudding")
  - P [green slime](/wiki/Green_slime "Green slime")

- Press [p]() to [pay](/wiki/Pay "Pay") your [shopping](/wiki/Shop "Shop") bill.

* Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [p]() to [put on](/wiki/Put_on "Put on") a [ring](/wiki/Ring "Ring"), an [amulet](/wiki/Amulet "Amulet"), or other accessory.

- Press [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [p]() to [repeat previous messages](/wiki/Repeat_previous_messages "Repeat previous messages").

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a port of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), [pickpockets](/index.php?title=Pickpocket\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pickpocket (page does not exist)") use the p glyph, while [phase shifters](/index.php?title=Phase_shifter\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Phase shifter (page does not exist)") use the P glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the p glyph is given to the [piercer](/wiki/Piercer "Piercer"), while the P glyph is given to the [purple worm](/wiki/Purple_worm "Purple worm") - both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), and continue to use those glyphs up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the piercer is made into a [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class"), with three distinct types of piercer introduced, and the pudding or ooze monster class is introduced and given the P glyph - the purple worm is moved to the [worm](/wiki/Worm "Worm") monster class, w.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces three new monsters that use the P glyph:

- P pudding or ooze:

  - P [moldy pudding](/wiki/Moldy_pudding "Moldy pudding")
  - P [shoggoth](/wiki/Shoggoth_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Shoggoth (SLASH'EM)")
  - P [giant shoggoth](/wiki/Giant_shoggoth "Giant shoggoth")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

P

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter P serves the following purposes:

  • p represents a piercer:
    • p rock piercer
    • p iron piercer
    • p glass piercer
  • P represents a pudding or ooze:
    • P gray ooze
    • P brown pudding
    • P black pudding
    • P green slime
  • Press p to pay your shopping bill.
  • Press shift + p to put on a ring, an amulet, or other accessory.
  • Press ctrl + p to repeat previous messages.

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a port of Jay Fenlason's Hack, pickpockets use the p glyph, while phase shifters use the P glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the p glyph is given to the piercer, while the P glyph is given to the purple worm - both monsters retain their glyphs for their appearance in Hack 1.0, and continue to use those glyphs up to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the piercer is made into a monster class, with three distinct types of piercer introduced, and the pudding or ooze monster class is introduced and given the P glyph - the purple worm is moved to the worm monster class, w.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces three new monsters that use the P glyph:

  • P pudding or ooze:
    • P moldy pudding
    • P shoggoth
    • P giant shoggoth
